decoworld.editor.renderer

Class TileActor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Actor
      • decoworld.editor.renderer.TileActor

  • public class TileActor
extends com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Actor
    The actor implementation for a Tile. This is done because Actors make it easy to detect whether or not they're being hovered over by the mouse, and it helps to keep application-specific code out of the renderer.

      • TileActor

        public TileActor(decoworld.model.world.map.Tile tile,
         int x,
         int y,
         TextureCache cache)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Construct a new TileActor.
        Parameters:
        tile - The tile we're using.
        x - Our X coordinate.
        y - Our Y coordinate.
        cache - The texture cache used for fetching the Tile's texture.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if tile or cache are null or if x or y are < 0
